messages.title: IMPORTANT MEETING - ALL WELCOME
messages.content: Thursday May 18th, 7:30pm at St George's Church, Kemptown. Come and find out why we are putting aside tribal party politics to JOIN TOGETHER to defeat the Conservatives.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Green Party withdraws parliamentary candidate in Kemptown to launch progressive politics in Brighton. Save the NHS from cuts and privatisation. Stop grammar schools, and schools' funding cuts. End growing inequality between the 'haves' and 'have nots'. Protect the environment and tackle climate change. Give you a say over Brexit. Introduce a fairer voting system.

issues.brexitEurope: Give you a say over Brexit.
issues.education: Stop grammar schools, and schools' funding cuts. Protect our local schools such as Moulsecoomb Primary School which loses £823 per pupil under the Tories.
issues.environment: Protect the environment and tackle climate change. Help reduce air quality.
issues.health: Save the NHS from cuts and privatisation.
issues.transport: Help reduce homelessness: our city has one of the highest levels in the UK - outside London - one in 69 people. Help tackle poor local rail services.

community.content: Help reduce homelessness: our city has one of the highest levels in the UK - outside London - one in 69 people.

quotes.text: People who have spent years campaigning in our city took the decision to put aside party allegiances and work together so we have the best possible chance of delivering a fairer voting system and beating the Tories on 8 June. These choices were not easy, indeed they are acts of political bravery.

images.caption: Caroline Lucas, Co-Leader of The Green Party with the Green Party's Davy Jones
